docs.lead_paragraph: Expanding health insurance to cover everyone over the age of 51 might help save costs to Medicare in the long run, according to a new study reported in the Annals of Internal Medicine.

headline.main: People Uninsured Before Medicare Have Higher Medical Bills, Study Finds

docs.abstract: People between ages 51 and 64 who have intermittent health insurance, or none at all, end up costing Medicare about $1,023 more per year when they turn 65 than people who have had coverage all along, a new study finds.
docs.snippet: People between ages 51 and 64 who have intermittent health insurance, or none at all, end up costing Medicare about $1,023 more per year when they turn 65 than people who have had coverage all along, a new study finds.

docs.lead_paragraph: Thanks for your questions on therapy pets and autism. See Dr. Nishawala's responses, below.

headline.main: Readers Ask: Pets, People and Autism

docs.abstract: Dr. Melissa A. Nishawala of New York University's Child Study Center answers readers questions on pets, companion animals and autism spectrum disorder.
docs.snippet: Dr. Melissa A. Nishawala of New York University's Child Study Center answers readers questions on pets, companion animals and autism spectrum disorder.

docs.lead_paragraph: Update by Katharine Q. Seelye | 6:53 p.m. Add Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg of New York City to the list of those endorsing the idea of a health care overhaul, though not a particular bill.

headline.main: Former Bush Health Secretary Thompson Praises the Senate Finance Bill

docs.abstract: Tommy Thompson, a well-known Republican and former Bush health secretary, says he supports the Senate Finance Committee's health bill.
docs.snippet: Tommy Thompson, a well-known Republican and former Bush health secretary, says he supports the Senate Finance Committee's health bill.

docs.lead_paragraph: Leo E. Strine Jr. is vice chancellor of the Delaware Court of Chancery.

headline.main: Why Excessive Risk-Taking Is Not Unexpected

docs.abstract: DealBook Dialogue: Leo E. Strine Jr., the vice chancellor of the Delaware Court of Chancery, argues that excessive risk-taking is not unexpected if prudent regulation regulation weakens while the pressures to generate profits increase.
docs.snippet: DealBook Dialogue: Leo E. Strine Jr., the vice chancellor of the Delaware Court of Chancery, argues that excessive risk-taking is not unexpected if prudent regulation regulation weakens while the pressures to generate profits increase.

headline.main: White Coats in the Rose Garden, as Obama Rallies Doctors on Health Overhaul

docs.abstract: Obama rallies a group of doctors, representing all 50 states, in support of a health care overhaul.
docs.snippet: Obama rallies a group of doctors, representing all 50 states, in support of a health care overhaul.

docs.lead_paragraph: Today is the first heave in a week of heavy lifting for Democrats pushing for a health care reform bill by the end of the year. President Obama hosts a mid-morning meeting today with doctors from around the country - at least one from every state - and speaks in the Rose Garden about the urgency of his overhaul.

headline.main: The Early Word: Another Push on Health Care

docs.abstract: This week's agenda is jammed with health care discussions and strategy sessions on Afghanistan and Iran.
docs.snippet: This week's agenda is jammed with health care discussions and strategy sessions on Afghanistan and Iran.

docs.lead_paragraph: When I mentioned that I had bought my dog his own health care policy, friends snickered But two years later, my decision has more than paid off in what is hardly a laughing matter.
docs.snippet: When I mentioned that I had bought my dog his own health care policy, friends snickered But two years later, my decision has more than paid off in what is hardly a laughing matter.

docs.lead_paragraph: If Republicans think something might be good for the president, they’re against it — whether or not it’s good for America.
docs.snippet: If Republicans think something might be good for the president, they’re against it — whether or not it’s good for America.

docs.lead_paragraph: The stock market slump and rising college costs have combined to drive all but two of the nation’s 18 such funds into the red.

docs.lead_paragraph: Europeans don’t get why Americans don’t agree that universal health coverage is a fundamental right. I don’t think the debate is about health.
